snippet: The president of Turkey wants Ottoman Turkish taught to schoolchildren, a plan that has drawn widespread criticism from parents and political opponents.
abstract: Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan promises to introduce compulsory classes in Ottoman Turkish, older form of national language, into national school curriculum; plan has drawn widespread criticism from parents and political opponents.
lead_paragraph: The president of Turkey wants Ottoman Turkish taught to schoolchildren, a plan that has drawn widespread criticism from parents and political opponents.

headline.main: Turks Feud Over Change in Education
